body:
Ok. I delete table by table from the command until I found the table with the problem. The table have primary key, but have compute columns:

CREATE TABLE [dbo].[tc_maestro_saldos](
	[ms_empresa] [smallint] NOT NULL,
	[ms_cuenta] [int] NOT NULL,
	[ms_moneda] [dbo].[Catalogo] NOT NULL,
	[ms_estados] [varchar](10) NOT NULL,
	**[ms_estadocontable]  AS ([dbo].[fn_estadocontable]([ms_estados])),
	[ms_flgprocesacta]  AS (case when substring([ms_estados],(1),(1))='0' OR substring([ms_estados],(1),(1))<>'0' AND ([ms_saldoanterior]<>(0) OR [ms_saldoactual]<>(0) OR [ms_diferidos]<>(0)) then (1) else (0) end),**
	[ms_formacobro] [dbo].[Catalogo] NULL,
	[ms_calpagominimo] [dbo].[Catalogo] NULL,
	[ms_cuporotativo] [money] NOT NULL,
	[ms_cupodiferido] [money] NOT NULL,
	[ms_disponiblerotativo] [money] NOT NULL,
	[ms_disponiblediferido] [money] NOT NULL,
	[ms_autorizacionesrot] [money] NOT NULL,
	[ms_autorizacionesdif] [money] NOT NULL,
	[ms_sobregiro] [money] NOT NULL,
	**[ms_saldocontadocorte]  AS (case when ([ms_saldoanterior]-[ms_intantbonificable])>(0) then [ms_saldoanterior]-[ms_intantbonificable] else (0) end),
	[ms_saldoactual] [money] NOT NULL,**

 CONSTRAINT [PK_tc_maestro_saldos] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED 
(
	[ms_cuenta] ASC,
	[ms_moneda] ASC,
	[ms_empresa] ASC
)WITH (PAD_INDEX = OFF, STATISTICS_NORECOMPUTE = OFF, IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF, ALLOW_ROW_LOCKS = ON, ALLOW_PAGE_LOCKS = ON, FILLFACTOR = 70, OPTIMIZE_FOR_SEQUENTIAL_KEY = OFF) ON [PRIMARY]
) ON [PRIMARY]
GO


There is a problem with compute columns in  EF .NET 10?
As I said, the same table works fine with EF .NET 9

> Possible related and/or duplicate issue:
> 
> * [NullReferenceException scaffolding when no primary key setÂ #29516](https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/issues/29516)

In my case all The tables have primary key, but one have compute columns.

@vasquezjames I'd like to investigate this - especially as you're reporting a possible regression from EF 9 to 10, but the SQL script you provided above does not work: there are various columns and types/aliases referenced there which do not exist, probably because you copy-pasted a partial script.

Can you please provide a minimal, self-contained SQL script which creates a database that reproduces the problem when scaffolding?

> [@vasquezjames](https://github.com/vasquezjames) I'd like to investigate this - especially as you're reporting a possible regression from EF 9 to 10, but the SQL script you provided above does not work: there are various columns and types/aliases referenced there which do not exist, probably because you copy-pasted a partial script.
> 
> Can you please provide a minimal, self-contained SQL script which creates a database that reproduces the problem when scaffolding?

Thanks! Ok. I create a clean databse for test inside that database I put all SQL scripts necesary:

USE db_test
GO
/****** Object:  Table [dbo].[tc_maestro_saldos]    Script Date: 8/13/2025 7:51:01 PM ******/
SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO
SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO
drop TABLE [dbo].[tc_maestro_saldos]
go
drop TYPE [dbo].[usuario] 
go
drop TYPE [dbo].[Catalogo]
go
drop function [dbo].[fn_estadocontable]
go
CREATE TYPE [dbo].[usuario] FROM [varchar](20) NOT NULL
go
CREATE TYPE [dbo].[Catalogo] FROM [varchar](8) NOT NULL
GO
CREATE function [dbo].[fn_estadocontable]
   (@pp_estados varchar(10))
RETURNS varchar(8)

BEGIN
  declare @es_estadocontable catalogo
  select @es_estadocontable = '0' -- 0=Normal, otros estados.
  RETURN @es_estadocontable
END
GO
CREATE TABLE [dbo].[tc_maestro_saldos](
	[ms_empresa] [smallint] NOT NULL,
	[ms_cuenta] [int] NOT NULL,
	[ms_moneda] [dbo].[Catalogo] NOT NULL,
	[ms_estados] [varchar](10) NOT NULL,
	[ms_estadocontable]  AS ([dbo].[fn_estadocontable]([ms_estados])),
	[ms_flgprocesacta]  AS (case when substring([ms_estados],(1),(1))='0' OR substring([ms_estados],(1),(1))<>'0' AND ([ms_saldoanterior]<>(0) OR [ms_saldoactual]<>(0) OR [ms_diferidos]<>(0)) then (1) else (0) end),
	[ms_formacobro] [dbo].[Catalogo] NULL,
	[ms_calpagominimo] [dbo].[Catalogo] NULL,
	[ms_cuporotativo] [money] NOT NULL,

**The same example works fine in EF .NET 9.0.7**

This is the command with only the table with the problem:

dotnet ef dbcontext scaffold --force --no-pluralize --use-database-names "Server=SERVIDOR;Database=db_test;User Id=sa;Password=xxxxxxx;Persist Security Info=False;Trust Server Certificate=true" Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer -o db_test -t tc_maestro_saldos

rename.to: Scaffolding fails when a column exists with a default constraint name and a value equal to the CLR default

issue.title: Remove default constraint name annotation when removing the value annotations

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Not sure we have good testing possibilities for this kind of bug; but as the fix is trivial and time is short, I verified manually.

Fixes #36567

body: Confirmed, thanks - this regression was introduced in #36067 (the new default constraint name feature). Submitted #36576 to fix for rc.1.

> Confirmed, thanks - this regression was introduced in [#36067](https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/pull/36067) (the new default constraint name feature). Submitted [#36576](https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/pull/36576) to fix for rc.1.

Thanks! I will have to wait until RC1 to see this bug fixed or could be fixed in Preview 8 ð?
There will be no preview 8; the new preview after preview 7 (in one month) is rc.1.
